TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed GeometryModel3D extends System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D

remarks.format:
## Remarks If you need to create a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D> that uses multiple materials, you must use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3DGroup> class to combine multiple GeometryModel3D objects.
The front and back sides of the GeometryModel3D are determined by the winding order of the triangles in the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D>. The front side winds counter clockwise.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeometryModel3D.Material%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeometryModel3D.BackMaterial%2A> properties may be <xref:System.Drawing.Brushes.Transparent%2A> or `null`. When the material is transparent, you cannot see that side of the triangle, but hit testing works as usual. When the material is `null`, you cannot see it, and hit testing does not work.
## Examples The following code excerpt creates a GeometryModel3D in the shape of a cube.
[!code-xml[Basic3D#Basic3DXAML3DN3](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/Basic3D.BlankSample/Window1.xaml#basic3dxaml3dn3)]
The following code excerpt uses a GeometryModel3D whose <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeometryModel3D.Geometry%2A> is defined as a static resource.
[!code-xml[Animate3Drotation#Animate3DRotation3DN1](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/Animate3DRotation.BlankSample/Window1.xaml#animate3drotation3dn1)]

Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of with the specified Geometry3D and Material.
Gets or sets the used to render the back of this .
Docs.value: The applied to the back of the . The default value is **null**.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The back side of a mesh is determined by the triangle winding order. Ordinarily, back faces are not rendered unless the object is transformed or animated. Back faces are never rendered when BackMaterial is `null`. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
